title: Lloviu cuevavirus sequencing protocol

source.description:
Mix the following components in an 0.2mL 8-strip tube;
Component Volume
50µM random hexamers
10mM dNTPs mix (10mM each)
Template RNA
Total

source.body: Viral RNA input from a native sample should be between Ct 18-35. If Ct is between 12-15, then dilute the sample 100-fold in water, if between 15-18 then dilute 10-fold in water. This will reduce the likelihood of PCR-inhibition.
A mastermix should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and aliquoted into PCR strip tubes. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description: Gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Incubate the reaction as follows:
for

Add the following to the annealed template RNA:
Component Volume
SSIV Buffer
100mM DTT
RNaseOUT RNase Inhibitor
SSIV Reverse Transcriptase
Total

source.body: A mastermix should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and added to the denatured RNA in the extraction and sample addition cabinet. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description: Gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Incubate the reaction as follows:
Hold at
If required resuspend lyophilised primers at a concentration of 100µM each

source.body:
Three different primer set were designed for this protocol with the usage of Primal Scheme. These original sets were updated wit alternative primers based on the generated sequence data and empirical experiences.
1, LLOV_400bp
This set generates 400 basepair long amplicons with ~75 basepair overlaps.
2, LLOV_500bp
This set generates 500 basepair long amplicons with ~50 basepair overlaps.
3, LLOV_2000bp
This set generates 2000 basepair long amplicons with ~130 basepair overlaps. These primers were choosen from LLOV_400bp set and reutilised here as a new .

source.description:
Generate primer pool stocks by adding
of each odd region primer to a
Eppendorf labelled “Pool 1 (100µM)” and each even region primer to a
Eppendorf labelled “Pool 2 (100µM)”. These are your 100µM stocks of each primer pool.
Final volume of the 100µM stocks:
LLOV_400bp Pool 1: 405 µl (81 primer)
LLOV_400bp Pool 2: 410 µl (82 primer)
LLOV_500bp Pool 1: 290 µl (58 primer)
LLOV_500bp Pool 2: 260 µl (52 primer)
LLOV_2000bp Pool 1: 50 µl (10 primer)
LLOV_2000bp Pool 2: 50 µl (10 primer)

source.body: Primers should be diluted and pooled in the mastermix cabinet which should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Dilute this primer pool 1:10 in molecular grade water, to generate 10µM primer stocks. It is recommend that multiple aliquots of each primer pool are made to in case of degradation or contamination.

source.body: Primers need to be used at a final concentration of 0.015µM per primer.

source.description:
In the mastermix hood set up the multiplex PCR reactions as follows in 0.2mL 8-strip PCR tubes:
LLOV_400bp
Component Pool 1 Pool 2
5X Q5 Reaction Buffer
10 mM dNTPs
Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase
V3 Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)
Nuclease-free water
Total
LLOV_500bp
Component Pool 1 Pool 2
5X Q5 Reaction Buffer
10 mM dNTPs
Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase
V3 Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)
Nuclease-free water
Total
LLOV_2000bp
Component Pool 1 Pool 2
5X Q5 Reaction Buffer
10 mM dNTPs
Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase
V3 Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)
Nuclease-free water
Total

source.body: A PCR mastermix for each pool should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and aliquoted into PCR strip tubes. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description:
In the extraction and sample addition cabinet add
cDNA to each tube and mix well by pipetting.

source.body: The extraction and sample addition cabinet should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Pulse centrifuge the tubes to collect the contents at the bottom of the tube.

Set-up the following program on the thermal cycler:
Step Temperature Time Cycles
Heat Activation
1
Denaturation
25-35
Annealing
25-35
Hold
Indefinite 1

source.body: Cycle number should be 25 for Ct 18-21 up to a maximum of 35 cycles for Ct 35.

Label a
Eppendorf tube for each sample and assemble the following PCR dilution for each sample:
Component Volume
Pool 1 PCR reaction
Pool 2 PCR reaction
Nuclease-free water

source.body: The PCR post-clean up concentration is typically around . This assumption means we can make a significant saving in terms of protocol time for only a slight loss in barcode representation. To get a better result you should use multiple primer sets (LLOV_400bp, LLOV_500bp, LLOV_2000bp) with different barcodes. This can be useful in later bioinformatic analysis (i.e. read length filtering).

source.description:
Label another
Eppendorf tube for each sample.

source.body: Input to the one-pot native barcoding reaction is 50ng per sample. Process at least 6 samples plus one negative control per library in order to have sufficient material to load on the sequencer at the end.

source.description: Barcode the amplicon pools using the one-pot native barcoding approach.

source.body: Final library can be now be stored in 10 mM Tris pH 8 at 4°C for up to a week if needed otherwise proceed directly to MinION sequencing.

description:
ARTIC-like amplicon sequencing protocol for MinION for Lloviu cuevavirus
The increasing risk of emerging infectious diseases (EIDs) for humanity is a constantly growing problem. Next-generation sequencing rapidly increased the discovery of distant filovirus species worldwide. Lloviu virus is currently the only known member of Filoviridae family found in Europe. We prepared and tested this protocol on Hungarian Lloviu positive native samples found in our laboratory. We are aware of the extreme rarity of LLOV, we provide this protocol to facilitate research attempts and widen the possibilities of future studies.
